name: Muslim Wellness Foundation
mission: Muslim Wellness Foundation (MWF) is a 501(c)(3) nonprofit organization dedicated to promoting healing and well-being in American Muslim communities through dialogue, education and training. The MWF approach to health is interdisciplinary, intergenerational, spiritually grounded, community based, and justice-oriented. From being the first Muslim organization in the country to offer Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) trainings to establishing the annual Black Muslim Psychology Conference (BMPC), MWF has been an outspoken leader in fostering visions for wellness and healing. Our programs demonstrate our keen awareness of the link between oppression, wellness and how communities heal, grow, thrive, and experience joy in the midst of it all. We will continue to lead the way in shifting the conversation on mental health, addiction and trauma - from one narrowly focused on stigma to a healing-centered model of collective well-being, faith, identity and belonging. Join us on this journey.
theoryOfChange: The MWF approach to health is interdisciplinary, intergenerational, spiritually grounded, community based, and justice-oriented, aiming to shift from stigma-focused models to healing-centered models of collective well-being.

all_citations.claim: The organization's profile metadata and financial fields are documented, though it lacks a formal star rating.
The foundation reported total revenue of $223,205 and a program expense ratio of 100.0%.
The organization conducts Mental Health First Aid (MHFA) trainings and the Black Muslim Psychology Conference (BMPC).
MWF is dedicated to promoting healing and emotional well-being in the American Muslim Community.
The organization accepts general donations and sadaqah to support its mental health initiatives.

While it directs 100.0% to programs, the low working capital of 0.2 months and low data confidence score of 0.3 suggest challenges in long-term financial sustainability and evidence-based reporting [1][2].
